intro: Mniothamnea, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, often blue or purple, ray flowers and bracts that resemble leaves. These plants are typically found in coastal or saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Mniothamnea species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. They play a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion in coastal regions.
